# RuntimeOps - AI Crawlers and LLM Guide

## Project Overview

RuntimeOps is a production debugging utilities platform for engineers. We provide tools to help debug scheduling, timezones, tokens, and runtime issues.

Website: https://runtimeops.dev

## Key Pages

- **Home** (`/`) - Project overview and features
- **Tools** (`/tools`) - Complete tool directory
- **Cron Validator** (`/tools/cron`) - Validate cron expressions across dialects
- **About** (`/about`) - Mission and data philosophy
- **Privacy** (`/privacy`) - Privacy policy and data handling
- **Terms** (`/terms`) - Terms of service
- **Contact** (`/contact`) - Support and inquiry channels
- **Status** (`/status`) - System status and uptime

## Technical Stack

- **Framework:** Next.js 14+ (App Router)
- **Language:** TypeScript
- **Styling:** Tailwind CSS
- **Hosting:** Vercel
- **Components:** Custom built with React

## Core Features

### Cron Dialect Validator (Live)
- Validate cron expressions
- Support for: Azure, Quartz, Unix, AWS, Vercel
- Schedule simulation
- Error detection and reporting

### Coming Soon
- Epoch/Ticks Converter
- Timezone/DST Simulator
- JWT Expiry Inspector

## Data Privacy

**Important:** RuntimeOps does not store user input. All tool operations happen in-browser. No cron expressions, tokens, or personal data are transmitted or stored server-side.

## Company Information

- **Purpose:** Production debugging utilities
- **Focus:** Correctness, clarity, speed
- **Target Users:** Software engineers, DevOps, SREs
- **License:** MIT (source available on GitHub)
